title: brew installation has SSL trouble and building from source fails because of dos line endings
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `latest version from brew`
OS & Version: OSX 10.11.4
#### Expected behaviour

I'm trying to install geth using the recommended brew option:

```
brew tap ethereum/ethereum
brew install ethereum
```

I expect it to install correctly.
#### Actual behaviour

```
$ brew install ethereum
==> Installing ethereum from ethereum/ethereum
==> Downloading https://build.ethdev.com/builds/bottles/ethereum-1.4.5.el_capitan.bottle.21.tar.gz

curl: (60) SSL certificate problem: Invalid certificate chain
More details here: http://curl.haxx.se/docs/sslcerts.html

curl performs SSL certificate verification by default, using a "bundle"
 of Certificate Authority (CA) public keys (CA certs). If the default
 bundle file isn't adequate, you can specify an alternate file
 using the --cacert option.
If this HTTPS server uses a certificate signed by a CA represented in
 the bundle, the certificate verification probably failed due to a
 problem with the certificate (it might be expired, or the name might
 not match the domain name in the URL).
If you'd like to turn off curl's verification of the certificate, use
 the -k (or --insecure) option.
Error: Failed to download resource "ethereum"
Download failed: https://build.ethdev.com/builds/bottles/ethereum-1.4.5.el_capitan.bottle.21.tar.gz
Warning: Bottle installation failed: building from source.
==> Cloning https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum.git
Updating /Library/Caches/Homebrew/ethereum--git
==> Checking out branch master
==> go env
==> make all
Last 15 lines from /Users/kramer65/Library/Logs/Homebrew/ethereum/02.make:

make: build/flags.sh: Command not found
for cmd in `ls ./cmd/`; do \
         build/env.sh go build -i -v  -o build/bin/$cmd ./cmd/$cmd; \
    done
/bin/sh: build/env.sh: /bin/sh^M: bad interpreter: No such file or directory
/bin/sh: build/env.sh: /bin/sh^M: bad interpreter: No such file or directory
/bin/sh: build/env.sh: /bin/sh^M: bad interpreter: No such file or directory
/bin/sh: build/env.sh: /bin/sh^M: bad interpreter: No such file or directory
/bin/sh: build/env.sh: /bin/sh^M: bad interpreter: No such file or directory
/bin/sh: build/env.sh: /bin/sh^M: bad interpreter: No such file or directory
/bin/sh: build/env.sh: /bin/sh^M: bad interpreter: No such file or directory
/bin/sh: build/env.sh: /bin/sh^M: bad interpreter: No such file or directory
/bin/sh: build/env.sh: /bin/sh^M: bad interpreter: No such file or directory
make: *** [all] Error 126

READ THIS: https://git.io/brew-troubleshooting
If reporting this issue please do so at (not Homebrew/brew):
  https://github.com/ethereum/homebrew-ethereum/issues
```

So first the problem is something with SSL certs, but I wouldn't know what I can do about that?
The second problem is that the files to build from source contain dos line endings. Normally I would use dos2unix to convert the relevant files, but I wouldn't know where these files reside.

Does anybody have any tips on how I can solve this? All tips are welcome!
Please clone the source and compile yourself (just run `make`) while we sort out the issue with build.ethdev.com.

I'm not really succesfull in building from source either:

```
$ git clone https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum
Cloning into 'go-ethereum'...
remote: Counting objects: 50079, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (6/6), done.
remote: Total 50079 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 50073
Receiving objects: 100% (50079/50079), 58.80 MiB | 1.46 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (34161/34161), done.
Checking connectivity... done.
$ cd go-ethereum/
$ make geth
make: build/flags.sh: Command not found
build/env.sh go build -i -v  -o build/bin/geth ./cmd/geth
make: build/env.sh: No such file or directory
make: *** [geth] Error 1
$ make
make: build/flags.sh: Command not found
build/env.sh go build -i -v  -o build/bin/geth ./cmd/geth
make: build/env.sh: No such file or directory
make: *** [geth] Error 1
```

Any ideas what's wrong here?
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
